intro: Laplacea cameliifolia, commonly known as the camellia-leaved laplacea, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with dark green, leathery leaves resembling those of camellias. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
